articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopened Tuesday night after being closed to vehicle traffic for several months. The bridge, spanning the South Umpqua River, closed in February for a major rehabilitation project.
articles.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopens after rehabilitation project

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Senior Vice President at Columbia Bank David Adamson said Thursday that Columbia Bank is committed to helping people.
articles.title: Columbia Bank, UCAN team up for November donation barrels

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Paul Eckel said his time in the U.S. Army and Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) turned him into a tested combatant, but his time in the North Umpqua River has healed him immensely.
articles.title: Healing through rafting: Paul Eckel documents journey post service

articles.description: Paul Romero said he originally joined the U.S. Navy to pay off college with a GI bill.

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A student-led walkout is planned Monday at Winston Middle School to raise awareness about bullying and safety concerns. Organized by 13-year-old Ashton, the event has gained attention from parents and community members online.
articles.title: Walkout Planned at Winston Middle School to Address Bullying Concerns

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: PacifiCorp, the Oregon-based utility owned by Warren Buffett, warns of a potential liquidity crisis amid lawsuits over the 2020 wildfires. Facing billions in damages and credit downgrades, the company says ongoing litigation threatens its long-term operations.
articles.title: PacifiCorp Credit Downgrade Raises Bankruptcy Concerns Amid Wildfire Lawsuits

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Canyonville ODOT station will remain fully staffed after avoiding budget cuts. The small crew plays a vital role in keeping I-5 and nearby highways safe, responding quickly to winter storms, emergencies, and incidents across southern Douglas County.
articles.title: Canyonville ODOT Station Retains Funding, Continues Key Role in Highway Safety

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Upscale Resale in Sutherlin is closing at the end of November after 30 months in business. The consignment shop is offering half off all items and waiving its share of sales as a thank-you to the community for its support.
articles.title: Upscale Resale to Close After 30 Months, Offers Half-Off Storewide Sale

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Attorneys for Dwayne Michael Lauka have filed multiple motions ahead of his February trial in the death of Terry Lea Deane, including a challenge to palm print evidence. Prosecutors maintain the evidence is valid and relevant to the case.
articles.title: Pretrial Motions Filed in Oakland Homicide Case

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Oregon residents will receive a 9.863% “kicker” credit on 2025 tax returns after a $1.41 billion surplus was confirmed. The credit will boost refunds or reduce taxes owed, with details available through the Oregon Department of Revenue.
articles.title: Oregon Taxpayers to Receive 9.863% “Kicker” Credit After $1.41 Billion Surplus

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Oregonians can now access their full November SNAP benefits after a federal court ordered the Trump Administration to release withheld funds. The Oregon Department of Human Services confirmed payments are restored, following Gov. Tina Kotek’s declaration of a hunger emergency.
articles.title: Oregon SNAP Benefits Fully Restored After Federal Court Ruling

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: November 7, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: DINT detectives arrested 38-year-old Chet Evans of Myrtle Creek in Roseburg after finding suspected fentanyl, meth residue, and weapons. Evans faces drug and weapons charges and remains in custody on a Lane County probation detainer.
articles.title: DINT Arrests Myrtle Creek Man in Roseburg Drug Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Jason Nathaniel Briggs, 43, of Roseburg, was arrested Oct. 28 on a charge of first-degree sexual abuse and later released on bail. Court records show three no-contact orders were issued. He’s due back in court Dec. 15 for a status hearing. The case remains under investigation.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested, Released on Bail in First-Degree Sexual Abuse Case

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Fire crews extinguished a semi-truck fire on I-5 southbound near Winston Thursday morning. The blaze started in the engine compartment and spread to the cab and trailer loaded with paper rolls. No injuries were reported, and the cause is under investigation.
articles.title: Southbound I-5 semi-truck fire near Winston extinguished
